column4: I upgraded to 8.04 now when ever I log in it just hangs there at a blank orange screen.
did you try running in the command line?
How does one do that? O:
Sithe:ã€€ctrl-alt-F1 will open a command line.
I'll try it hold on
Um Sithe, if you're still there... ctrl-alt-f7 will get you back to the GUI...
Yes the command line opens
Can you log in, Sithe?
I could already from the GUI. But AFTER I login in it just hangs at that orange screen (the one before the desktop loads). So basically the desktop doesn't load.
Right, Sithe, so what I'm saying is that if you can run everything normally from the command line, the install is probably fine, but you don't have the right video drivers.
Ohh =\
Is there a command to get the right ones?
what video card are you running?
I honestly have no idea. Its an old laptop with an integrated graphics card.
Hmm. Well that's a problem since there are different drivers for different cards.
It was working fine before the upgrade
I'm not too experienced with video drivers, so you'd better ask someone else, but I suggest you do as was said above and try booting in safe mode and see what happens.
Agi Radeon RV250
Wups ATI*
Spoonman: Thanks
I run an Nvidia, so I definitely can't help you... Sorry.
